content: So, right now the T-compiler meeting sometimes has to decide on backports for T-rustdoc. This is mostly to be sure they don't pass under the radar as in most cases they don't have enough context to decide, so I could probably remove these backports items from the agenda at all.

But before doing that I need to be sure these backports are not left behind, so if you want (and it's useful) I can simply remind T-rustdoc here on Zulip when I notice a backport request that looks stale. I look at issues anyway at least once a week, so for me it's no additional work.
Or otherwise, if you have or want another kind of process for that, it's ok as well. It's just that I don't many backports for T-rustdoc so I thought establishing a procedure would be overhead
I don't even know who to mention :) so cc @GuillaumeGomez @Joshua Nelson @jsha
There is @Manish Goregaokar and @CraftSpider too (I don't find camelid here ><)
but yes please, that'd be super appreciated!
@apiraino there is a @_T-rustdoc group
backports will get a thread created here when the T-rustdoc label is added, e.g. nominated: #85304
my question would be, what is meant to happen then? after discussion here should someone from T-rustdoc add the beta-accepted label?

Nemo157 said:

my question would be, what is meant to happen then? after discussion here should someone from T-rustdoc add the beta-accepted label?

yes
and then people from T-infra take care of actually backporting it
(sometimes they ask for help if there's really tricky conflicts, but that's rare)

Nemo157 said:

backports will get a thread created here when the T-rustdoc label is added, e.g. nominated: #85304

Only if both T-rustdoc and I-nominated are present though.
